name: grace
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: grace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a quality of moving in a smooth, relaxed, and attractive way

example.eg: Joanna has natural grace and elegance.

dsense.name: grace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the quality of being pleasantly polite, or a willingness to be fair and honest

example.eg: They accepted their defeat with good grace.
example.egtrans: 他们很有风度地认输了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: ways of behaving that are considered polite and pleasant

example.eg: Ken is sadly lacking in social graces.
example.egtrans: 糟糕的是，肯在社交场合很没有风度。

dsense.name: grace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: approval or kindness, especially (in the Christian religion) that is freely given by God to all humans
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指上帝赐予人类的）恩典，恩宠

example.eg: Betty believed that it was through divine grace that her husband had recovered from his illness.
example.egtrans: 贝蒂认为全靠上天开恩她的丈夫才得以痊愈。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: through the kindness or help of God
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 承蒙上帝的恩典，上帝开恩

example.eg: By the grace of God, the pilot managed to land the damaged plane safely.
example.egtrans: 蒙上帝开恩，飞行员成功地将受损的飞机安全降落。

dsense.name: grace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a prayer said by Christians before a meal to thank God for the food

example.eg: The children always say grace at dinnertime.
example.egtrans: 孩子们在用餐前总是要做感恩祷告。

dsense.name: grace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a period of time left or allowed before something happens or before something must be done

example.eg: The exams have been postponed, so the students have a few days' grace before they start.
example.egtrans: 考试推迟了，所以学生们得以晚几天进考场。

name: grace
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be in a place, on a thing etc. and make it look more attractive

example.eg: Her face has graced the covers of magazines across the world.
example.egtrans: 她的面孔出现在全世界各种杂志的封面上，使之赫然生辉。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to honour people by taking part in something
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 光临…而使之蓬筚生辉；莅临而为（某人）增光

example.eg: We are delighted that the mayor will be gracing us with his presence at our annual dinner.
example.egtrans: 市长将光临我们每年一度的宴会，我们感到万分荣幸。

example.eg: So you've finally decided to grace us with your presence, have you? (= You are late.)
example.egtrans: 你看，你终于肯光临寒舍了，大驾难起啊，是吗？（幽默地表示“你迟到了”这个意思）

name: Grace
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to address or refer to a duke, duchess or archbishop
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 大人，阁下，夫人（对公爵、公爵夫人、女公爵或大主教的尊称）
